reviewText: From much simpler times, loved Space Patrol as a kid, still like it.  Wish some of the 15 minute versions were available.
Contains episodes 195 and 210, which was the final show.
Just as much fun as it was 60 something years ago. I'm back eating wheat checks.
Video was OK considering the original source! Brought back great memories!
I bought it as a gift for an elderly friend and he absolutely loved it. Said it took him back to his childhood.
I really enjoy watching Space Patrol as when I was a young boy. Great stuff. Brings back alot og good memories

Space Patrol was one of the great science fiction shows of early 50s TV.  Broadcast live and recorded on film, the episodes showcased imaginative writing, spirited acting and inventive effects.  Ed Kemmer, who played  Commander Corry, was himself a World War II flying ace, having piloted a  P-51 Mustang on many missions and was shot down behind enemy lines -- so he  makes a very convincing hero!  The commercials on the show are equally  delightful, hawking Space Patrol premiums that are prized collectors items  today.  All in all, a thoroughly charming and endearing show.
